# Subject

**Protocol**

A publisher that exposes a method for outside callers to publish elements.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol Subject<Output, Failure> : AnyObject, Publisher
```

## Overview

A subject is a publisher that you can use to ”inject” values into a stream, by calling its [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subject/send(_:)] method. This can be useful for adapting existing imperative code to the Combine model.

## Delivering elements to subscribers

- **send(_:)**: Sends a value to the subscriber.
- **send()**: Sends a void value to the subscriber.

## Delivering life cycle events to subscribers

- **send(subscription:)**: Sends a subscription to the subscriber.
- **send(completion:)**: Sends a completion signal to the subscriber.

## Subjects

- **CurrentValueSubject**: A subject that wraps a single value and publishes a new element whenever the value changes.
- **PassthroughSubject**: A subject that broadcasts elements to downstream subscribers.

## Inherits From

- Publisher

## Conforming Types

- CurrentValueSubject
- PassthroughSubject
